title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Studies
body: Research Studies         Researcher investigates lichens to measure air quality. NPS photo  Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park has an active Natural Resources program that conducts studies and surverys. The park is also a part of the Southeast Alaska Inventory and Monitoring program (SEAN). Learn more about the scientific studies at Klondike Gold Rush NHP with these reports: Bat Inventory: A Pilot Study Breeding Bird Survey, Off Road Breeding Bird Surveys, Waterbird Surveys, and Eagle Nest Monitoring- 2009 Klondike Gold Rush NHP Bird Inventory- 2004 Inventory of Marine and Estuarine Fishes inSoutheast and Central Alaska National Parks- 2003 SEAN Report Monitoring Air Quality in Southeast Alaska National Parks: Linking Air Quality to ecologoical effects  Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park Vascular Plant Inventory-2006 Klondike Gold Rush Amphibian Monitoring Report- 2009 Weather and Climate Inventory National Park Service Southeast Alaska Network- 2007 Klondike Gold Rush NHP Natural Resources Program Report- 2009 DRAFT
